oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from W.R. Rankin to W.B. Gordon, Esq.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from W.R. Rankin to W.B. Gordon, Esq. in Columbia dealing with a property sale in Jasper. He writes on the poor condition of the debt owed to Mr. Gordon for the property and speculates on the financial situation of the purchaser of the property. He does discuss how the property purchaser has been industriously selling the corn, clearing, fencing, and building and encourages Mr. Gordon to see this in person and suggests that he try to reclaim the property so that it could earn "rents."
